channel.title: jacob fisher poetry
channel.description: Recent content on jacob fisher poetry

item.title: EMBERS AND ENDING EMBRACES
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description:
A dark light now unnights my soul. A bare interior within Where grey walls now entrap me in Blinding depression. Yet I see No windows; no doors; I had screamed, Stuck in stagnation; sinister Past.
Why can’t it be more peaceful? And future feels funeral for Ever. You both could make my presents Playful. My gaiety should Not be culpable, but from the Gallery.
‘Encore!’ it’s justice Ruled my prosecution, upon Whom I have so much relied so Inexorably, tightening Nooses.
Mine in a dim bathroom Has become surrounded by an Everest of balsam. I am Desolate.
In the water-room, I feel escaped from my dead bed. Twist.
Violently; thrust different Yesterday. Now my home is.
Wretched.

item.title: I lived by the chalice
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description:
Fresh poison for sale, buy now Before someone you know can. No, we don’t do executions here; We’re a friendly business. Try your Other friends.
They’re nice.

item.title: Flicker
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description:
TVs flickering in the street, and Strobing the docile faces, and Pulsing the pleasures of another people.
Biharmonic stereo, play. This mono thinking delay Pushes us into dismay; Ultimately the stereo stray.
Boring books burning bright: Soot makes you stutter. Darkness now hidden behind The anthracite cloak. Please don't let the salamander get me...
Listen, and listen well. Seeming specious, how alien it seems! Chanting chords: now a diminished art. Say what you came to say, and go! We're tired of the nude liberties; We want the world to be blue. ~~~ D'you remember that? Blue. Red blue red. Viscous and venous.

item.title: Cabs at Christmas
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description:
The taxi driver desolately peers With beautiful blues blaring in his cab. His cheeks becoming stained and daubed with tears. Awaiting blithely that next drunken drab.
His sharpened scalpel, recently stolen, Now covets blood once more on Christmas eve. 'Crime pays the dime on time,' he chants his omen. Snowy teardrops always join begs of leave.
This sweet piano dampens heavy souls Because the midnight sun will never set. 'Baby, baby, don't you know these rolling roads Make the midnight monster in me?' Forget...
Mind of murder, scalpel of salvation; Now I bid, rid of this cold creation.

item.title: The Society
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description:
'Who am I?' you asked casually. They swept away the philosophy, Called it a flagrant waste of time. You paused and realised the irony.
Misunderstanding is ubiquitous but Understood. Tell me, tell me. Tell me what I am, Who I am and How I am. Because You do it anyway.
Tell me where I am: Perplexed miens of perceived ineptness Or inherited doubt. rid, rid, riddance.
Life's a game, but not for us. Retrospectively, you were Never really happy. So tell me, executioner: Why am I, Still here?
We've stopped thinking—so You're no longer being. 'All around!' they clamour, 'We've come to see your last stammer.'

item.title: Metaphysical me
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description:
Not stupidity. Not intelligence. Not individuality. Not humanity. ~~~ Watch Death larking, 'Cause he always loved it— And you can see it in his eyes.
I run to him; I can't see; I feel; I-I! ~~~ What's the last sentiment? Why so hesitant? It's only me. Crazed, yet resident desperation.

item.title: Hangman
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description:
Hang the man, Guess the letter. Fuck the man with Your incessant stupidity. ~~~ Game of young; Gamble of life. Why do you summon Me to your tall Towers of bloodied Execution? ~~~ Vowel, two consonants, and another beam. The noose tightens As the pens strokes.
DEATH IS FREEDOM

item.title: "Friendship"
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description: The third rule is broke; And our cathedral bursts. Fracture the walls But not our spirit.
